intro: Anchusa granatensis, commonly known as the Granada bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Anchusa granatensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
